Curvature¶

Curvature of the point cloud is computed by surficial curvature.

Curvature Property¶

Attributes

Methods

Methods documentation

class CurvatureProperty.CurvatureProperty(points, principal_curvatures=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Curvature property initially holds only the principal curvatures. However if an additional type of curvature is transferred in “kwargs” it will be assigned, with its name (as sent by kwargs) and an additional dictionary.

Shape_Index¶
curvadness¶

Curvadness property defined by

\[\kappa_{curvadness}=\sqrt{\frac{\lambda_\max ^2 + \lambda_\min ^2}{2}}\]
gaussian_curvature¶

Gaussian curvature

Computed by

\[\kappa_{Gaussian}=\lambda_{\max} \cdot \lambda_{\min}\]

normalize_values(bool)[source]¶

A flag whether to normalize values of principal curvature (k1, k2) to [0,1] with 2 being the invalid value

Parameters

bool (bool) – boolean flag for normalization of the values

Parameters

  • values (k1 and k2) – the curvature objects to assign

Calculate similarity curvature (E,H)

According to [RK06].

Parameters

k1,k2 – principal curvatures (k1>k2)

Returns

rgb: RGB color for every point, values of similarity curvature (E,H)

Curvature Factory¶

Methods

Methods documentation

class CurvatureFactory.CurvatureFactory[source]¶

curvature parameters computation

classmethod curvature_by_3parameters(neighborhood, normal)[source]¶

Curvature computation based on fundamental form when fitting bi-quadratic surface.

Parameters

  • neighborhood (PointNeighborhood.PointNeighbohhod, np.ndarray, PointSet.PointSet) – the neighbors according to which the curvature is computed

  • normal (np.array) – normal to the point which the curvature is computed

Returns

minimal and maximal curvature

Return type

tuple

Algorithm

  1. Rotate so that the normal will be [0 0 1]

    the bi-quadratic surface coefficients \(d,e,f\) are zero and the fitting is of three parameters:

    \[z(x,y) = ax^2 + by^2 + cxy\]

  2. Second derivatives dictate the curvature

    \[\begin{split}{\bf H} = \begin{bmatrix} 2a & c \\ c & 2b \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]

  3. The principal curvatures are computed as:

    \[C=\sqrt{c^2+\left[\left(a-b\right)\right]^2}\]
    \[\kappa_{1,2} = \frac{a+b}{2}\pm C\]
classmethod pointSetOpen3D_3parameters(pointset3d, neighbors_property, min_points_in_neighborhood=5, min_points_in_sector=2, valid_sectors=7, num_sectors=8, invalid_value=-999, verbose=False)[source]¶

Curvature of a PointSetOpen3D with its normals and neighborhood via the three-parameters algorithm.

Warning

If a pointset3D is sent without its normals computed in advance, the normals will be computed according to the first point neighborhood parameters

Parameters

  • pointset3d (PointSetOpen3D.PointSetOpen3D) – the point cloud

  • neighbors_property (NeighborsProperty.NeighborsProperty) – the neighbors property of the point cloud

  • min_points_in_neighborhood (int) – minimal number of points in a neighborhood to make it viable for curvature computation. Default: 5

  • min_points_in_sector (int) – minimal points in a sector to be considered valid. Default: 2

  • valid_sectors (int) – minimal sectors needed for a point to be considered good. Default: 7

  • num_sectors (int) – the number of sectors the circle is divided to. Default: 8

  • invalid_value (float) – value for invalid curvature (points that their curvature cannot be computed). Default: -999

  • verbose (bool) – print inter running messages. default: False

Returns

curvature property

Return type

CurvatureProperty

See also

curvature_by_3parameters()

classmethod raster_fundamentalForm(raster, ksize=3, sigma=2.5, gradientType='L1')[source]¶

Compute raster curvature based on first fundamental form

Parameters

  • raster (np.array or RasterData) – the raster image

  • ksize – window/kernel size (equivalent to neighborhood size)

  • sigma (float) – for Gaussian blurring

  • gradientType (str) – ‘L1’ or ‘L2’ for derivatives computation

Returns

curvature map

Return type

curvatureProperty

classmethod tensorProperty_3parameters(tensorProperty, min_points=5)[source]¶

Compute curvature for tensors, via the three-parameters algorithm.

Curvature for tensors that have less points than min_points will not be computed.

Parameters

  • tensorProperty (TensorProperty.TensorProperty) – the tensors of the points cloud (precomputed)

  • min_points – minimum points required to compute curvature for a point

Returns

Curvature property

Return type

CurvatureProperty

See also

curvature_by_3parameters()

classmethod umbrella_curvature(neighbrohood, normals, min_obj_size=0.01, alpha=0.05, min_points_in_neighborhood=8, min_points_in_sector=1, valid_sectors=7, num_sectors=8, invalid_value=-999, cuvatureProperty=None, verbose=False)[source]¶

Compute an umbrella curvature,

Defined in [FK14]

Based on the idea that the size of the curvature (openness) is influenced by the projection of the neighboring points on the normal vector.

\[\kappa_{um} = \sum_{i=1}^m \left| \frac{N_i-p}{\left|N_i-p\right|}\cdot \bf{n}\right|\]

with \(N_i\) the neighbor i of point \(p\), and \(\bf{n}\) the normal at point \(p\).

Note

Each projection is checked so it will not be statistically zero in confidence level of \(\alpha\).

Parameters

  • neighbrohood (NeighborsProperty.NeighborsProperty) – neighborhood property of a point cloud

  • normals (NormalsProperty.NormalsProperty) – normals property of a point cloud

  • min_obj_size (float) – minimal object size - usually refers to surface roughness

  • alpha (float) – confidence value for statistical test

  • min_points_in_neighborhood (int) – minimal number of points in a neighborhood to make it viable for curvature computation. Default: 8

  • min_points_in_sector (int) – minimal points in a sector to be considered valid. Default: 1

  • valid_sectors (int) – minimal sectors needed for a point to be considered good. Default: 7

  • num_sectors (int) – the number of sectors the circle is divided to. Default: 8

  • invalid_value (float) – value for invalid curvature (points that their curvature cannot be computed). Default: -999

  • cuvatureProperty (CurvatureProperty) – A curvature property to update with the umbrella curvature. If None, a new curvature property will be created, with the principal curvatures as None.

  • verbose (bool) – print inter running messages. default: False

Returns

umbrella curvature for all points that have enough neighbors for the curvature to be computed.

Return type

np.array

See also

__good_point() and __checkNeighborhood()
